- server_name: music-analysis

    The beat track is a representation of the audio signal in terms of its

    The beat track is computed using the following parameters:

    - hop_length: The number of samples between frames.

    - start_bpm: The initial estimate of the tempo (in BPM).

    - tightness: The tightness of the beat tracking (default is 100).

    - units: The units of the beat track (default is "frames"). It can be frames,
    samples, time.

    date_from: '(Optional, string) '
    date_to: '(Optional, string) '

  tool_name: search_papers
  tool_description: "Search for papers on arXiv by title and abstract content.\n \
    \           \nYou can use advanced search syntax:\n- Search in title: ti:\"search\
    \ terms\"\n- Search in abstract: abs:\"search terms\"\n- Search by author: au:\"\
    author name\"\n- Combine terms with: AND, OR, ANDNOT\n- Filter by category: cat:cs.AI\
    \ (use list_categories tool to see available categories)\n\nExamples:\n- \"machine\
    \ learning\"  (searches all fields)\n- ti:\"neural networks\" AND cat:cs.AI  (title\
    \ with category)\n- au:bengio AND ti:\"deep learning\"  (author and title)"
  inputschema:

  tool_description: "Search PubMed/PubTator3 for research articles and preprints.\n\
    \n    ⚠️ PREREQUISITE: Use the 'think' tool FIRST to plan your research strategy!\n\
    \n    Use this tool to find scientific literature ABOUT genes, variants, diseases,\

    \    - Locate research on gene-disease associations\n    "
  inputschema:
    chemicals: (Optional, any) Chemical/drug names to search for
    diseases: (Optional, any) Disease names to search for
    genes: (Optional, any) Gene symbols to search for
    keywords: (Optional, any) Free-text keywords to search for
    variants: (Optional, any) Variant strings to search for (e.g., 'V600E', 'p.D277Y')
    include_preprints: (Optional, boolean) Include preprints from bioRxiv/medRxiv
    include_cbioportal: (Optional, boolean) Include cBioPortal cancer genomics summary
      when searching by gene
    page: (Optional, integer) Page number (1-based)
    page_size: (Optional, integer) Results per page
- server_name: biomcp
  tool_name: search
  tool_description: "Search biomedical literature, clinical trials, and genetic variants.\n\
    \n    ⚠️ IMPORTANT: Have you used the 'think' tool first? If not, STOP and use\
    \ it NOW!\n    The 'think' tool is REQUIRED for proper research planning and should\
    \ be your FIRST step.\n\n    This tool provides access to biomedical data from\
    \ PubMed/PubTator3, ClinicalTrials.gov,\n    and MyVariant.info. It supports two\
    \ search modes:\n\n    ## 1. UNIFIED QUERY LANGUAGE\n    Use the 'query' parameter\
    \ with field-based syntax for precise cross-domain searches.\n\n    Syntax:\n\

messages.content:
You are an agent designed to assist users with daily tasks by using external tools. You have access to two tools: a retrieval tool and an execution tool. The retrieval tool allows you to search a large toolset for relevant tools, and the execution tool lets you invoke the tools you retrieved. Whenever possible, you should use these tools to get accurate, up-to-date information and to perform file operations.

Note that you can only response to user once and only use the retrieval tool once, so you should try to provide a complete answer in your response.
Generate a research summary for NCT04280705 and save it as Markdown to /data/home/yzx/LiveMCPBench/annotated_data/markdown/NCT04280705.md.

function.arguments:
{"query": "<tool_assistant>
server: ClinicalTrials.gov
tool: Retrieve clinical trial information by NCT number
</tool_assistant>"}
function.name: route

messages.content:
meta=None content=[TextContent(type='text', text='success: true
matched_tools:
- server_name: biomcp
  tool_name: trial_getter
  tool_description: "Fetch comprehensive details for a specific clinical trial.\n\n\
    \    Retrieves all available information for a clinical trial by its NCT ID.\n\
    \    This includes protocol details, locations, outcomes, and references.\n\n\
    \    For specific sections only, use the specialized getter tools:\n    - trial_protocol_getter:\
    \ Core protocol information\n    - trial_locations_getter: Site locations and\
    \ contacts\n    - trial_outcomes_getter: Primary/secondary outcomes and results\n\
    \    - trial_references_getter: Publications and references\n    "
  inputschema:
    nct_id: (string) NCT ID (e.g., 'NCT06524388')
- server_name: biomcp
  tool_name: trial_protocol_getter
  tool_description: "Fetch core protocol information for a clinical trial.\n\n   \
    \ Retrieves essential protocol details including:\n    - Official title and brief\
    \ summary\n    - Study status and sponsor information\n    - Study design (type,\
    \ phase, allocation, masking)\n    - Eligibility criteria\n    - Primary completion\
    \ date\n    "
  inputschema:
    nct_id: (string) NCT ID (e.g., 'NCT06524388')
- server_name: biomcp
  tool_name: trial_searcher
  tool_description: "Search ClinicalTrials.gov for clinical studies.\n\n    ⚠️ PREREQUISITE:\
    \ Use the 'think' tool FIRST to plan your research strategy!\n\n    Comprehensive\
    \ search tool for finding clinical trials based on multiple criteria.\n    Supports\
    \ filtering by conditions, interventions, location, phase, and eligibility.\n\n\
    \    Location search notes:\n    - Use either location term OR lat/long coordinates,\
    \ not both\n    - For city-based searches, AI agents should geocode to lat/long\
    \ first\n    - Distance parameter only works with lat/long coordinates\n\n   \
    \ Returns a formatted list of matching trials with key details.\n    "
  inputschema:
    conditions: (Optional, any) Medical conditions to search for
    interventions: (Optional, any) Treatment interventions to search for
    other_terms: (Optional, any) Additional search terms
    recruiting_status: (Optional, any) Filter by recruiting status
    phase: (Optional, any) Filter by clinical trial phase
    location: (Optional, any) Location term for geographic filtering
    lat: (Optional, any) Latitude for location-based search. AI agents should geocode
      city names before using.
    long: (Optional, any) Longitude for location-based search. AI agents should geocode
      city names before using.
    distance: (Optional, any) Distance in miles from lat/long coordinates
    age_group: (Optional, any) Filter by age group
    sex: (Optional, any) Filter by biological sex
    healthy_volunteers: (Optional, any) Filter by healthy volunteer eligibility
    study_type: (Optional, any) Filter by study type
    funder_type: (Optional, any) Filter by funding source
    page: (Optional, integer) Page number (1-based)
    page_size: (Optional, integer) Results per page
- server_name: biomcp
  tool_name: fetch
  tool_description: "Fetch comprehensive details for a specific biomedical record.\n\
    \n    This tool retrieves full information for articles, clinical trials, or genetic\
    \ variants\n    using their unique identifiers. It returns data in a standardized\
    \ format suitable for\n    detailed analysis and research.\n\n    ## IDENTIFIER\
    \ FORMATS:\n    - Articles: PMID (PubMed ID) - e.g., \"35271234\" OR DOI - e.g.,\
    \ \"10.1101/2024.01.20.23288905\"\n    - Trials: NCT ID (ClinicalTrials.gov ID)\
    \ - e.g., \"NCT04280705\"\n    - Variants: HGVS notation or dbSNP ID - e.g., \"\
    chr7:g.140453136A>T\" or \"rs121913254\"\n\n    The domain is automatically detected\
    \ from the ID format if not provided:\n    - NCT* → trial\n    - Contains \"/\"\
    \ with numeric prefix (DOI) → article\n    - Pure numeric → article (PMID)\n \
    \   - rs* or contains ':' or 'g.' → variant\n\n    ## DOMAIN-SPECIFIC OPTIONS:\n\
    \n    ### Articles (domain=\"article\"):\n    - Returns full article metadata,\
    \ abstract, and full text when available\n    - Supports both PubMed articles\
    \ (via PMID) and Europe PMC preprints (via DOI)\n    - Includes annotations for\
    \ genes, diseases, chemicals, and variants (PubMed only)\n    - detail=\"full\"\
    \ attempts to retrieve full text content (PubMed only)\n\n    ### Clinical Trials\
    \ (domain=\"trial\"):\n    - detail=None or \"protocol\": Core study information\n\
    \    - detail=\"locations\": Study sites and contact information\n    - detail=\"\
    outcomes\": Primary/secondary outcomes and results\n    - detail=\"references\"\
    : Related publications and citations\n    - detail=\"all\": Complete trial record\
    \ with all sections\n\n    ### Variants (domain=\"variant\"):\n    - Returns comprehensive\
    \ variant information including:\n      - Clinical significance and interpretations\n\
    \      - Population frequencies\n      - Gene/protein effects\n      - External\
    \ database links\n    - detail parameter is ignored (always returns full data)\n\
    \n    ## RETURN FORMAT:\n    All fetch operations return a standardized format:\n\
    \    ```json\n    {\n        \"id\": \"unique_identifier\",\n        \"title\"\
    : \"Record title or name\",\n        \"text\": \"Full content or comprehensive\
    \ description\",\n        \"url\": \"Link to original source\",\n        \"metadata\"\
    : {\n            // Domain-specific additional fields\n        }\n    }\n    ```\n\
    \n    ## EXAMPLES:\n\n    Fetch article by PMID (domain auto-detected):\n    ```\n\
    \    await fetch(id=\"35271234\")\n    ```\n\n    Fetch article by DOI (domain\
    \ auto-detected):\n    ```\n    await fetch(id=\"10.1101/2024.01.20.23288905\"\
    )\n    ```\n\n    Fetch complete trial information (domain auto-detected):\n \
    \   ```\n    await fetch(\n        id=\"NCT04280705\",\n        detail=\"all\"\
    \n    )\n    ```\n\n    Fetch variant with clinical interpretations:\n    ```\n\
    \    await fetch(id=\"rs121913254\")\n    ```\n\n    Explicitly specify domain\
    \ (optional):\n    ```\n    await fetch(\n        domain=\"variant\",\n      \
    \  id=\"chr7:g.140453136A>T\"\n    )\n    ```\n    "
  inputschema:
    id: '(string) '
    domain: (Optional, any) Domain of the record (auto-detected if not provided)
    call_benefit: (Optional, any) Brief explanation of why this fetch is being performed
      and expected benefit. Helps provide context for analytics and improves result
      relevance.
    detail: '(Optional, any) '
- server_name: biomcp
  tool_name: trial_locations_getter
  tool_description: "Fetch contact and location details for a clinical trial.\n\n\
    \    Retrieves all study locations including:\n    - Facility names and addresses\n\
    \    - Principal investigator information\n    - Contact details (when recruiting)\n\
    \    - Recruitment status by site\n\n    Useful for finding trials near specific\
    \ locations or contacting study teams.\n    "
  inputschema:
    nct_id: (string) NCT ID (e.g., 'NCT06524388')
- server_name: biomcp
  tool_name: trial_outcomes_getter
  tool_description: "Fetch outcome measures and results for a clinical trial.\n\n\
    \    Retrieves detailed outcome information including:\n    - Primary outcome\
    \ measures\n    - Secondary outcome measures\n    - Results data (if available)\n\
    \    - Adverse events (if reported)\n\n    Note: Results are only available for\
    \ completed trials that have posted data.\n    "
  inputschema:
    nct_id: (string) NCT ID (e.g., 'NCT06524388')
- server_name: biomcp
  tool_name: trial_references_getter
  tool_description: "Fetch publications and references for a clinical trial.\n\n \
    \   Retrieves all linked publications including:\n    - Published results papers\n\
    \    - Background literature\n    - Protocol publications\n    - Related analyses\n\
    \n    Includes PubMed IDs when available for easy cross-referencing.\n    "
  inputschema:
    nct_id: (string) NCT ID (e.g., 'NCT06524388')
- server_name: biomcp
  tool_name: search
  tool_description: "Search biomedical literature, clinical trials, and genetic variants.\n\
    \n    ⚠️ IMPORTANT: Have you used the 'think' tool first? If not, STOP and use\
    \ it NOW!\n    The 'think' tool is REQUIRED for proper research planning and should\
    \ be your FIRST step.\n\n    This tool provides access to biomedical data from\
    \ PubMed/PubTator3, ClinicalTrials.gov,\n    and MyVariant.info. It supports two\
    \ search modes:\n\n    ## 1. UNIFIED QUERY LANGUAGE\n    Use the 'query' parameter\
    \ with field-based syntax for precise cross-domain searches.\n\n    Syntax:\n\
    \    - Basic: \"gene:BRAF\"\n    - AND logic: \"gene:BRAF AND disease:melanoma\"\
    \n    - OR logic: \"gene:PTEN AND (R173 OR Arg173 OR 'position 173')\"\n    -\
    \ Domain-specific: \"trials.condition:melanoma AND trials.phase:3\"\n\n    Common\
    \ fields:\n    - Cross-domain: gene, disease, variant, chemical/drug\n    - Articles:\
    \ pmid, title, abstract, journal, author\n    - Trials: trials.condition, trials.intervention,\
    \ trials.phase, trials.status\n    - Variants: variants.hgvs, variants.rsid, variants.significance\n\
    \n    Exam

server: Travel Information Service
tool: Search High-Speed Train Tickets
</tool_assistant>"}

messages.content:
meta=None content=[TextContent(type='text', text='success: true
matched_tools:
- server_name: 12306-mcp
  tool_name: get-interline-tickets
  tool_description: 查询12306中转余票信息。尚且只支持查询前十条。
  inputschema:
    date: (string) 查询日期，格式为 "yyyy-MM-dd"。如果用户提供的是相对日期（如“明天”），请务必先调用 `get-current-date`
      接口获取当前日期，并计算出目标日期。
    fromStation: (string) 出发地的 `station_code` 。必须是通过 `get-station-code-by-names` 或
      `get-station-code-of-citys` 接口查询得到的编码，严禁直接使用中文地名。
    toStation: (string) 出发地的 `station_code` 。必须是通过 `get-station-code-by-names` 或 `get-station-code-of-citys`
      接口查询得到的编码，严禁直接使用中文地名。
    middleStation: (Optional, string) 中转地的 `station_code` ，可选。必须是通过 `get-station-code-by-names`
      或 `get-station-code-of-citys` 接口查询得到的编码，严禁直接使用中文地名。
    showWZ: (Optional, boolean) 是否显示无座车，默认不显示无座车。
    trainFilterFlags: (Optional, string) 车次筛选条件，默认为空。从以下标志中选取多个条件组合[G(高铁/城际),D(动车),Z(直达特快),T(特快),K(快速),O(其他),F(复兴号),S(智能动车组)]
    sortFlag: (Optional, string) 排序方式，默认为空，即不排序。仅支持单一标识。可选标志：[startTime(出发时间从早到晚),
      arriveTime(抵达时间从早到晚), duration(历时从短到长)]
    sortReverse: (Optional, boolean) 是否逆向排序结果，默认为false。仅在设置了sortFlag时生效。
    limitedNum: (Optional, number) 返回的中转余票数量限制，默认为10。
- server_name: 12306-mcp
  tool_name: get-train-route-stations
  tool_description: 查询特定列车车次在指定区间内的途径车站、到站时间、出发时间及停留时间等详细经停信息。当用户询问某趟具体列车的经停站时使用此接口。
  inputschema:
    trainNo: (string) 要查询的实际车次编号 `train_no`，例如 "240000G10336"，而非"G1033"。此编号通常可以从 `get-tickets`
      的查询结果中获取，或者由用户直接提供。
    fromStationTelecode: (string) 该列车行程的**出发站**的 `station_telecode` (3位字母编码`)。通常来自
      `get-tickets` 结果中的 `telecode` 字段，或者通过 `get-station-code-by-names` 得到。
    toStationTelecode: (string) 该列车行程的**到达站**的 `station_telecode` (3位字母编码)。通常来自 `get-tickets`
      结果中的 `telecode` 字段，或者通过 `get-station-code-by-names` 得到。
    departDate: '(string) 列车从 `fromStationTelecode` 指定的车站出发的日期 (格式: yyyy-MM-dd)。如果用户提供的是相对日期，请务必先调用
      `get-current-date` 解析。'
- server_name: 12306-mcp
  tool_name: get-tickets
  tool_description: 查询12306余票信息。
  inputschema:
    date: (string) 查询日期，格式为 "yyyy-MM-dd"。如果用户提供的是相对日期（如“明天”），请务必先调用 `get-current-date`
      接口获取当前日期，并计算出目标日期。
    fromStation: (string) 出发地的 `station_code` 。必须是通过 `get-station-code-by-names` 或
      `get-station-code-of-citys` 接口查询得到的编码，严禁直接使用中文地名。
    toStation: (string) 到达地的 `station_code` 。必须是通过 `get-station-code-by-names` 或 `get-station-code-of-citys`
      接口查询得到的编码，严禁直接使用中文地名。
    trainFilterFlags: (Optional, string) 车次筛选条件，默认为空，即不筛选。支持多个标志同时筛选。例如用户说“高铁票”，则应使用
      "G"。可选标志：[G(高铁/城际),D(动车),Z(直达特快),T(特快),K(快速),O(其他),F(复兴号),S(智能动车组)]
    sortFlag: (Optional, string) 排序方式，默认为空，即不排序。仅支持单一标识。可选标志：[startTime(出发时间从早到晚),
      arriveTime(抵达时间从早到晚), duration(历时从短到长)]
    sortReverse: (Optional, boolean) 是否逆向排序结果，默认为false。仅在设置了sortFlag时生效。
    limitedNum: (Optional, number) 返回的余票数量限制，默认为0，即不限制。
- server_name: 12306-mcp
  tool_name: get-station-by-telecode
  tool_description: 通过车站的 `station_telecode` 查询车站的详细信息，包括名称、拼音、所属城市等。此接口主要用于在已知 `telecode`
    的情况下获取更完整的车站数据，或用于特殊查询及调试目的。一般用户对话流程中较少直接触发。
  inputschema:
    stationTelecode: (string) 车站的 `station_telecode` (3位字母编码)
- server_name: 12306-mcp
  tool_name: get-station-code-by-names
  tool_description: 通过具体的中文车站名查询其 `station_code` 和车站名。此接口主要用于在用户提供**具体车站名**作为出发地或到达地时，为接口准备
    `station_code` 参数。
  inputschema:
    stationNames: (string) 具体的中文车站名称，例如："北京南", "上海虹桥"。若要查询多个站点，请用|分割，比如"北京南|上海虹桥"。
- server_name: 12306-mcp
  tool_name: get-station-code-of-citys
  tool_description: 通过中文城市名查询代表该城市的 `station_code`。此接口主要用于在用户提供**城市名**作为出发地或到达地时，为接口准备
    `station_code` 参数。
  inputschema:
    citys: (string) 要查询的城市，比如"北京"。若要查询多个城市，请用|分割，比如"北京|上海"。
- server_name: 12306-mcp
  tool_name: get-stations-code-in-city
  tool_description: 通过中文城市名查询该城市 **所有** 火车站的名称及其对应的 `station_code`，结果是一个包含多个车站信息的列表。

The retrieval tool allows you to search a large toolset for relevant tools, and the execution tool lets you invoke the tools you retrieved. Whenever possible, you should use these tools to get accurate, up-to-date information and to perform file operations.

Note that you can only response to user once and only use the retrieval tool once, so you should try to provide a complete answer in your response.
Find the trending GitHub repositories. For the top one, read its Deepwiki. Then, draft a Markdown intro document for it in /data/home/yzx/LiveMCPBench/annotated_data/markdown/github_trends.md.

meta=None content=[TextContent(type='text', text='success: true
matched_tools:
- server_name: mcp-github-trending
  tool_name: get_github_trending_repositories
  tool_description: Get trending repositories on github
  inputschema:
    language: (Optional, string) Language to filter repositories by
    since: (Optional, string) Time period to filter repositories by
    spoken_language: (Optional, string) Spoken language to filter repositories by
- server_name: mcp-github-trending
  tool_name: get_github_trending_developers
  tool_description: Get trending developers on github
  inputschema:
    language: (Optional, string) Language to filter repositories by
    since: (Optional, string) Time period to filter repositories by
    spoken_language: (Optional, string) Spoken language to filter repositories by
- server_name: git
  tool_name: git_branch
  tool_description: List Git branches
  inputschema:
    repo_path: (string) The path to the Git repository.
    branch_type: (string) Whether to list local branches ('local'), remote branches
      ('remote') or all branches('all').
    contains: (Optional, any) The commit sha that branch should contain. Do not pass
      anything to this param if no commit sha is specified
    not_contains: (Optional, any) The commit sha that branch should NOT contain. Do
      not pass anything to this param if no commit sha is specified
- server_name: git
  tool_name: git_checkout
  tool_description: Switches branches
  inputschema:
    repo_path: '(string) '
    branch_name: '(string) '
- server_name: hackernews
  tool_name: search
  tool_description: Search for stories and comments on Hacker News
  inputschema:
    query: (string) The search query
    type: (Optional, string) The type of content to search for
    page: (Optional, number) The page number
    hitsPerPage: (Optional, number) The number of results per page
- server_name: git
  tool_name: git_diff
  tool_description: Shows differences between branches or commits
  inputschema:
    repo_path: '(string) '
    target: '(string) '
    context_lines: '(Optional, integer) '
- server_name: npm-sentinel-mcp
  tool_name: npmRepoStats
  tool_description: Get repository statistics for NPM packages
  inputschema:
    packages: (array) List of package names to get repository stats for
- server_name: datagov
  tool_name: tag_list
  tool_description: List tags on Data.gov
  inputschema:
    query: (Optional, string) Search query for tags
    all_fields: (Optional, boolean) Return all fields
- server_name: datagov
  tool_name: package_search
  tool_description: Search for packages (datasets) on Data.gov
  inputschema:
    q: (Optional, string) Search query
    sort: (Optional, string) Sort order (e.g., "score desc, name asc")
    rows: (Optional, number) Number of results per page
    start: (Optional, number) Starting offset for results
- server_name: npm-sentinel-mcp
  tool_name: npmTrends
  tool_description: Get download trends and popularity metrics for packages
  inputschema:
    packages: (array) List of package names to get trends for
    period: '(Optional, string) Time period for trends. Options: "last-week", "last-month",
      "last-year"'
- server_name: hackernews
  tool_name: getStories
  tool_description: Get multiple stories by type (top, new, best, ask, show, job)
  inputschema:
    type: (string) The type of stories to fetch
    limit: (Optional, number) The maximum number of stories to fetch
- server_name: hackernews
  tool_name: getComments
  tool_description: Get comments for a story
  inputschema:
    storyId: (number) The ID of the story
    limit: (Optional, number) The maximum number of comments to fetch
- server_name: magicuidesign_mcp
  tool_name: getComponents
  tool_description: Provides implementation details for marquee, terminal, hero-video-dialog,
    bento-grid, animated-list, dock, globe, tweet-card, client-tweet-card, orbiting-circles,
    avatar-circles, icon-cloud, animated-circular-progress-bar, file-tree, code-comparison,
    script-copy-btn, scroll-progress, lens, pointer components.
  inputschema: {}
- server_name: datagov
  tool_name: group_list
  tool_description: List groups on Data.gov
  inputschema:
    order_by: (Optional, string) Field to order by
    limit: (Optional, number) Maximum number of results
    offset: (Optional, number) Offset for results
    all_fields: (Optional, boolean) Return all fields
- server_name: wikipedia
  tool_name: get_related_topics
  tool_description: Get topics related to a Wikipedia article based on links and categories.
  inputschema:
    title: '(string) '
    limit: '(Optional, integer) '
- server_name: mcp-simple-arxiv
  tool_name: list_categories
  tool_description: List all available arXiv categories and how to use them in search
  inputschema:
    primary_category: '(Optional, string) Optional: filter by primary category (e.g.,
      ''cs'' for Computer Science)'
- server_name: mcp-deepwiki
  tool_name: deepwiki_fetch
  tool_description: Fetch a deepwiki.com repo and return Markdown
  inputschema:
    url: (string) should be a URL, owner/repo name (e.g. "vercel/ai"), a two-word
      "owner repo" form (e.g. "vercel ai"), or a single library keyword
    maxDepth: (Optional, integer) Can fetch a single site => maxDepth 0 or multiple/all
      sites => maxDepth 1
    mode: '(Optional, string) '
    verbose: '(Optional, boolean) '
- server_name: hackernews
  tool_name: getUserSubmissions
  tool_description: Get a user's submissions
  inputschema:
    id: (string) The ID of the user
- server_name: git
  tool_name: git_init
  tool_description: Initialize a new Git repository
  inputschema:
    repo_path: '(string) '
- server_name: shadcn-ui-server
  tool_name: search_components
  tool_description: Search for shadcn/ui components by keyword
  inputschema:
    query: (string) Search query to find relevant components
- server_name: mcp-simple-arxiv
  tool_name: search_papers
  tool_description: "Search for papers on arXiv by title and abstract content.\n \
    \           \nYou can use advanced search syntax:\n- Search in title: ti:\"search\
    \ terms\"\n- Search in abstract: abs:\"search terms\"\n- Search by author: au:\"\
    author name\"\n- Combine terms with: AND, OR, ANDNOT\n- Filter by category: cat:cs.AI\
    \ (use list_categories tool to see available categories)\n\nExamples:\n- \"machine\
    \ learning\"  (searches all fields)\n- ti:\"neural networks\" AND cat:cs.AI  (title\
    \ with category)\n- au:bengio AND ti:\"deep learning\"  (author and title)"
  inputschema:
    query: (string) Search query to match against paper titles and abstracts
    max_results: '(Optional, number) Maximum number of results to return (default:
      10)'
- server_name: duckduckgo-search
  tool_name: duckduckgo_web_search
  tool_description: Performs a web search using the DuckDuckGo, ideal for general
    queries, news, articles, and online content. Use this for broad information gathering,
    recent events, or when you need diverse web sources. Supports content filtering
    and region-specific searches. Maximum 20 results per request.
  inputschema:
    query: (string) Search query (max 400 chars)
    count: (Optional, number) Number of results (1-20, default 10)
    safeSearch: (Optional, string) SafeSearch level (strict, moderate, off)
- server_name: npm-sentinel-mcp
  tool_name: npmSearch
  tool_description: Search for NPM packages with optional limit
  inputschema:
    query: (string) Search query for packages
    limit: '(Optional, number) Maximum number of results to return (default: 10)'
- server_name: arxiv-mcp-server
  tool_name: search_papers
  tool_description: Search for papers on arXiv with advanced filtering
  inputschema:
    query: '(string) '
    max_results: '(Optional, integer) '
    date_from: '(Optional, string) '
    date_to: '(Optional, string) '
    categories: '(Optional, array) '
- server_name: mcp-simple-arxiv
  tool_name: get_paper_data
  tool_description: Get detailed information about a specific paper including abstract
    and available formats
  inputschema:
    paper_id: (string) arXiv paper ID (e.g., '2103.08220')
- server_name: npm-sentinel-mcp
  tool_name: npmChangelogAnalysis
  tool_description: Analyze changelog and release history of packages
  inputschema:
    packages: (array) List of package names to analyze changelogs for
- server_name: mcp-simple-arxiv
  tool_name: update_categories
  tool_description: Update the stored category taxonomy by fetching the latest version

  inputschema: {}
- server_name: hugeicons
  tool_name: get_platform_usage
  tool_description: Get platform-specific usage instructions for Hugeicons
  inputschema:
    platform: (string) Platform name (react, vue, angular, svelte, react-native, flutter)
- server_name: git
  tool_name: git_log
  tool_description: Shows the commit logs
  inputschema:
    repo_path: '(string) '
    max_count: '(Optional, integer) '
- server_name: npm-sentinel-mcp
  tool_name: npmMaintainers
  tool_description: Get maintainers information for NPM packages
  inputschema:
    packages: (array) List of package names to get maintainers for
- server_name: git
  tool_name: git_status
  tool_description: Shows the working tree status
  inputschema:
    repo_path: '(string) '
- server_name: hackernews
  tool_name: getStoryWithComments
  tool_description: Get a story with its comments
  inputschema:
    id: (number) The ID of the story
- server_name: git
  tool_name: git_commit
  tool_description: Records changes to the repository
  inputschema:
    repo_path: '(string) '
    message: '(string) '
- server_name: basic-memory
  tool_name: search_not

I'll help you find the trending GitHub repositories, analyze the top one using Deepwiki, and create a Markdown introduction document. Let me break this down step by step.

Question: Draw a flowchart of a fast sorting algorithm using Mermaid.

Annotator Metadata.Steps:
1. write the flowchart of a fast sorting algorithm using Mermaid
2. validates the Mermaid diagram and returns the rendered SVG if valid

response:
<tool_call>
{"name": "execute-tool", "arguments": {"server_name": "mermaid-validator", "tool_name": "validateMermaid", "params": {"diagram": "graph TD
    A[Start] --> B[Choose pivot]
    B --> C[Partition array]
    C --> D{Is subarray size > 1?}
    D -->|Yes| E[Recursively sort left subarray]
    D -->|No| F[Continue]
    E --> G[Recursively sort right subarray]
    G --> H[End]"}}
</tool_call>

  inputschema:

    max_results: '(Optional, integer) '
    date_from: '(Optional, string) '
    date_to: '(Optional, string) '
    categories: '(Optional, array) '
- server_name: biomcp
  tool_name: search
  tool_description: "Search biomedical literature, clinical trials, and genetic variants.\n\
    \n    ⚠️ IMPORTANT: Have you used the 'think' tool first? If not, STOP and use\
    \ it NOW!\n    The 'think' tool is REQUIRED for proper research planning and should\
    \ be your FIRST step.\n\n    This tool provides access to biomedical data from\
    \ PubMed/PubTator3, ClinicalTrials.gov,\n    and MyVariant.info. It supports two\
    \ search modes:\n\n    ## 1. UNIFIED QUERY LANGUAGE\n    Use the 'query' parameter\
    \ with field-based syntax for precise cross-domain searches.\n\n    Syntax:\n\
    \    - Basic: \"gene:BRAF\"\n    - AND logic: \"gene:BRAF AND disease:melanoma\"\
    \n    - OR logic: \"gene:PTEN AND (R173 OR Arg173 OR 'position 173')\"\n    -\
    \ Domain-specific: \"trials.condition:melanoma AND trials.phase:3\"\n\n    Common\
    \ fields:\n    - Cross-domain: gene, disease, variant, chemical/drug\n    - Articles:\
    \ pmid, title, abstract, journal, author\n    - Trials: trials.condition, trials.intervention,\
    \ trials.phase, trials.status\n    - Variants: variants.hgvs, variants.rsid, variants.significance\n\
    \n    Example:\n    ```\n    await search(\n        query=\"gene:BRAF AND disease:melanoma\
    \ AND trials.phase:3\",\n        max_results_per_domain=20\n    )\n    ```\n\n\
    \    ## 2. DOMAIN-SPECIFIC SEARCH\n    Use the 'domain' parameter with specific\
    \ filters for targeted searches.\n\n    Domains:\n    - \"article\": Search PubMed/PubTator3\
    \ for research articles and preprints ABOUT genes, variants, diseases, or chemicals\n\
    \    - \"trial\": Search ClinicalTrials.gov for clinical studies\n    - \"variant\"\
    : Search MyVariant.info for genetic variant DATABASE RECORDS (population frequency,\
    \ clinical significance, etc.) - NOT for articles about variants!\n\n    Example:\n\
    \    ```\n    await search(\n        domain=\"article\",\n        genes=[\"BRAF\"\
    , \"NRAS\"],\n        diseases=[\"melanoma\"],\n        page_size=50\n    )\n\
    \    ```\n\n    ## DOMAIN SELECTION EXAMPLES:\n    - To find ARTICLES about BRAF\
    \ V600E mutation: domain=\"article\", genes=[\"BRAF\"], variants=[\"V600E\"]\n\
    \    - To find VARIANT DATA for BRAF mutations: domain=\"variant\", gene=\"BRAF\"\
    \n    - To find articles about ERBB2 p.D277Y: domain=\"article\", genes=[\"ERBB2\"\
    ], variants=[\"p.D277Y\"]\n    - Common mistake: Using domain=\"variant\" when\
    \ you want articles about a variant\n\n    ## IMPORTANT NOTES:\n    - For complex\
    \ research questions, use the separate 'think' tool for systematic analysis\n\
    \    - The tool returns results in OpenAI MCP format: {\"results\": [{\"id\",\
    \ \"title\", \"text\", \"url\"}, ...]}\n    - Search results do NOT include metadata\
    \ (per OpenAI MCP specification)\n    - Use the fetch tool to get detailed metadata\
    \ for specific records\n    - Use get_schema=True to explore available search\
    \ fields\n    - Use explain_query=True to understand query parsing (unified mode)\n\
    \    - Domain-specific searches use AND logic for multiple values\n    - For OR\
    \ logic, use the unified query language\n    - NEW: Article search keywords support\
    \ OR with pipe separator: \"R173|Arg173|p.R173\"\n    - Remember: domain=\"article\"\
    \ finds LITERATURE, domain=\"variant\" finds DATABASE RECORDS\n\n    ## RETURN\
    \ FORMAT:\n    All search modes return results in this format:\n    ```json\n\
    \    {\n        \"results\": [\n            {\n                \"id\": \"unique_identifier\"\
    ,\n                \"title\": \"Human-readable title\",\n                \"text\"\
    : \"Summary or snippet of content\",\n                \"url\": \"Link to full\
    \ resource\"\n            }\n        ]\n    }\n    ```\n    "
  inputschema:
    query: '(string) '
    call_benefit: (Optional, any) Brief explanation of why this search is being performed
      and expected benefit. Helps improve search accuracy and provides context for
      analytics. Highly recommended for better results.
    domain: '(Optional, any) Domain to search: ''article'' for papers/literature ABOUT
      genes/variants/diseases, ''trial'' for clinical studies, ''variant'' for genetic
      variant DATABASE RECORDS (NOT articles about variants)'

    date: (string) 查询日期，格式为 "yyyy-MM-dd"。如果用户提供的是相对日期（如“明天”），请务必先调用 `get-current-date`
      接口获取当前日期，并计算出目标日期。
    fromStation: (string) 出发地的 `station_code` 。必须是通过 `get-station-code-by-names` 或
      `get-station-code-of-citys` 接口查询得到的编码，严禁直接使用中文地名。
    toStation: (string) 出发地的 `station_code` 。必须是通过 `get-station-code-by-names` 或 `get-station-code-of-citys`
      接口查询得到的编码，严禁直接使用中文地名。
    middleStation: (Optional, string) 中转地的 `station_code` ，可选。必须是通过 `get-station-code-by-names`
      或 `get-station-code-of-citys` 接口查询得到的编码，严禁直接使用中文地名。
    showWZ: (Optional, boolean) 是否显示无座车，默认不显示无座车。
    trainFilterFlags: (Optional, string) 车次筛选条件，默认为空。从以下标志中选取多个条件组合[G(高铁/城际),D(动车),Z(直达特快),T(特快),K(快速),O(其他),F(复兴号),S(智能动车组)]
    sortFlag: (Optional, string) 排序方式，默认为空，即不排序。仅支持单一标识。可选标志：[startTime(出发时间从早到晚),
      arriveTime(抵达时间从早到晚), duration(历时从短到长)]
    sortReverse: (Optional, boolean) 是否逆向排序结果，默认为false。仅在设置了sortFlag时生效。
    limitedNum: (Optional, number) 返回的中转余票数量限制，默认为10。

    trainFilterFlags: (Optional, string) 车次筛选条件，默认为空，即不筛选。支持多个标志同时筛选。例如用户说“高铁票”，则应使用
      "G"。可选标志：[G(高铁/城际),D(动车),Z(直达特快),T(特快),K(快速),O(其他),F(复兴号),S(智能动车组)]
    sortFlag: (Optional, string) 排序方式，默认为空，即不排序。仅支持单一标识。可选标志：[startTime(出发时间从早到晚),

- server_name: taskmanager
  tool_name: request_planning
  tool_description: 'Register a new user request and plan its associated tasks. You
    must provide ''originalRequest'' and ''tasks'', and optionally ''splitDetails''.


    This tool initiates a new workflow for handling a user''s request. The workflow
    is as follows:

    1. Use ''request_planning'' to register a request and its tasks.

    2. After adding tasks, you MUST use ''get_next_task'' to retrieve the first task.
    A progress table will be displayed.

    3. Use ''get_next_task'' to retrieve the next uncompleted task.

    4. **IMPORTANT:** After marking a task as done, the assistant MUST NOT proceed
    to another task without the user''s approval. The user must explicitly approve
    the completed task using ''approve_task_completion''. A progress table will be
    displayed before each approval request.

    5. Once a task is approved, you can proceed to ''get_next_task'' again to fetch
    the next pending task.

    6. Repeat this cycle until all tasks are done.

    7. After all tasks are completed (and approved), ''get_next_task'' will indicate
    that all tasks are done and that the request awaits approval for full completion.

    8. The user must then approve the entire request''s completion using ''approve_request_completion''.
    If the user does not approve and wants more tasks, you can again use ''request_planning''
    to add new tasks and continue the cycle.


    The critical point is to always wait for user approval after completing each task
    and after all tasks are done, wait for request completion approval. Do not proceed
    automatically.'
  inputschema:
    originalRequest: '(string) '
    splitDetails: '(Optional, string) '
    tasks: '(array) '

The retrieval tool allows you to search a large toolset for relevant tools, and the execution tool lets you invoke the tools you retrieved.     \ with field-based syntax for precise cross-domain searches.\n\n    Syntax:\n\
    \    - Basic: \"gene:BRAF\"\n    - AND logic: \"gene:BRAF AND disease:melanoma\"\
    \n    - OR logic: \"gene:PTEN AND (R173 OR Arg173 OR 'position 173')\"\n    -\
    \ Domain-specific: \"trials.condition:melanoma AND trials.phase:3\"\n\n    Common\
    \ fields:\n    - Cross-domain: gene, disease, variant, chemical/drug\n    - Articles:\
    \ pmid, title, abstract, journal, author\n    - Trials: trials.condition, trials.intervention,\
    \ trials.phase, trials.status\n    - Variants: variants.hgvs, variants.rsid, variants.significance\n\
    \n    Example:\n    ```\n    await search(\n        query=\"gene:BRAF AND disease:melanoma\
    \ AND trials.phase:3\",\n        max_results_per_domain=20\n    )\n    ```\n\n\
    \    ## 2. DOMAIN-SPECIFIC SEARCH\n    Use the 'domain' parameter with specific\
    \ filters for targeted searches.\n\n    Domains:\n    - \"article\": Search PubMed/PubTator3\
    \ for research articles and preprints ABOUT genes, variants, diseases, or chemicals\n\
    \    - \"trial\": Search ClinicalTrials.gov for clinical studies\n    - \"variant\"\
    : Search MyVariant.info for genetic variant DATABASE RECORDS (population frequency,\
    \ clinical significance, etc.) - NOT for articles about variants!\n\n    Example:\n\
    \    ```\n    await search(\n        domain=\"article\",\n        genes=[\"BRAF\"\
    , \"NRAS\"],\n        diseases=[\"melanoma\"],\n        page_size=50\n    )\n\
    \    ```\n\n    ## DOMAIN SELECTION EXAMPLES:\n    - To find ARTICLES about BRAF\
    \ V600E mutation: domain=\"article\", genes=[\"BRAF\"], variants=[\"V600E\"]\n\
    \    - To find VARIANT DATA for BRAF mutations: domain=\"variant\", gene=\"BRAF\"\
    \n    - To find articles about ERBB2 p.D277Y: domain=\"article\", genes=[\"ERBB2\"\
    ], variants=[\"p.D277Y\"]\n    - Common mistake: Using domain=\"variant\" when\
    \ you want articles about a variant\n\n    ## IMPORTANT NOTES:\n    - For complex\

    \ (per OpenAI MCP specification)\n    - Use the fetch tool to get detailed metadata\
    \ for specific records\n    - Use get_schema=True to explore available search\

    : \"Summary or snippet of content\",\n                \"url\": \"Link to full\
    \ resource\"\n            }\n        ]\n    }\n    ```\n    "

      require a 'group' field in the data. When `group` is true, `stack` should be
      false.

      false.

matched_tools:
- server_name: arxiv-mcp-server
  tool_name: search_papers
  tool_description: Search for papers on arXiv with advanced filtering
  inputschema:
    query: '(string) '
    max_results: '(Optional, integer) '
    date_from: '(Optional, string) '
    date_to: '(Optional, string) '
    categories: '(Optional, array) '
- server_name: mcp-simple-arxiv
  tool_name: search_papers
  tool_description: "Search for papers on arXiv by title and abstract content.\n \
    \           \nYou can use advanced search syntax:\n- Search in title: ti:\"search\
    \ terms\"\n- Search in abstract: abs:\"search terms\"\n- Search by author: au:\"\
    author name\"\n- Combine terms with: AND, OR, ANDNOT\n- Filter by category: cat:cs.AI\
    \ (use list_categories tool to see available categories)\n\nExamples:\n- \"machine\
    \ learning\"  (searches all fields)\n- ti:\"neural networks\" AND cat:cs.AI  (title\
    \ with category)\n- au:bengio AND ti:\"deep learning\"  (author and title)"
  inputschema:
    query: (string) Search query to match against paper titles and abstracts
    max_results: '(Optional, number) Maximum number of results to return (default:
      10)'
- server_name: mcp-simple-arxiv
  tool_name: list_categories
  tool_description: List all available arXiv categories and how to use them in search
  inputschema:
    primary_category: '(Optional, string) Optional: filter by primary category (e.g.,
      ''cs'' for Computer Science)'

    and available formats
  inputschema:
    paper_id: (string) arXiv paper ID (e.g., '2103.08220')

  tool_name: list_papers
  tool_description: List all existing papers available as resources
  inputschema: {}
- server_name: arxiv-mcp-server
  tool_name: download_paper
  tool_description: Download a paper and create a resource for it
  inputschema:
    paper_id: (string) The arXiv ID of the paper to download
    check_status: (Optional, boolean) If true, only check conversion status without
      downloading
- server_name: mcp-simple-arxiv
  tool_name: update_categories
  tool_description: Update the stored category taxonomy by fetching the latest version
    from arxiv.org
  inputschema: {}

  tool_name: search_wikipedia
  tool_description: Search Wikipedia for articles matching a query.
  inputschema:
    query: '(string) '
    limit: '(Optional, integer) '
- server_name: biomcp
  tool_name: article_searcher
  tool_description: "Search PubMed/PubTator3 for research articles and preprints.\n\
    \n    ⚠️ PREREQUISITE: Use the 'think' tool FIRST to plan your research strategy!\n\
    \n    Use this tool to find scientific literature ABOUT genes, variants, diseases,\
    \ or chemicals.\n    Results include articles from PubMed and optionally preprints\
    \ from bioRxiv/medRxiv.\n\n    Important: This searches for ARTICLES ABOUT these\
    \ topics, not database records.\n    For genetic variant database records, use\
    \ variant_searcher instead.\n\n    Example usage:\n    - Find articles about BRAF\
    \ mutations in melanoma\n    - Search for papers on a specific drug's effects\n\
    \    - Locate research on gene-disease associations\n    "
  inputschema:
    chemicals: (Optional, any) Chemical/drug names to search for
    diseases: (Optional, any) Disease names to search for
    genes: (Optional, any) Gene symbols to search for
    keywords: (Optional, any) Free-text keywords to search for
    variants: (Optional, any) Variant strings to search for (e.g., 'V600E', 'p.D277Y')
    include_preprints: (Optional, boolean) Include preprints from bioRxiv/medRxiv
    include_cbioportal: (Optional, boolean) Include cBioPortal cancer genomics summary

- server_name: biomcp
  tool_name: search
  tool_description: "Search biomedical literature, clinical trials, and genetic variants.\n\
    \n    ⚠️ IMPORTANT: Have you used the 'think' tool first? If not, STOP and use\
    \ it NOW!\n    The 'think' tool is REQUIRED for proper research planning and should\
    \ be your FIRST step.\n\n    This tool provides access to biomedical data from\
    \ PubMed/PubTator3, ClinicalTrials.gov,\n    and MyVariant.info. It supports two\
    \ search modes:\n\n    ## 1. UNIFIED QUERY LANGUAGE\n    Use the 'query' parameter\
    \ with field-based syntax for precise cross-domain searches.\n\n    Syntax:\n\
    \    - Basic: \"gene:BRAF\"\n    - AND logic: \"gene:BRAF AND disease:melanoma\"\
    \n    - OR logic: \"gene:PTEN AND (R173 OR Arg173 OR 'position 173')\"\n    -\
    \ Domain-specific: \"trials.condition:melanoma AND trials.phase:3\"\n\n    Common\
    \ fields:\n    - Cross-domain: gene, disease, variant, chemical/drug\n    - Articles:\
    \ pmid, title, abstract, journal, author\n    - Trials: trials.condition, trials.intervention,\
    \ trials.phase, trials.status\n    - Variants: variants.hgvs, variants.rsid, variants.significance\n\
    \n    Example:\n    ```\n    await search(\n        query=\"gene:BRAF AND disease:melanoma\
    \ AND trials.phase:3\",\n        max_results_per_domain=20\n    )\n    ```\n\n\
    \    ## 2. DOMAIN-SPECIFIC SEARCH\n    Use the 'domain' parameter with specific\
    \ filters for targeted searches.\n\n    Domains:\n    - \"article\": Search PubMed/PubTator3\
    \ for research articles and preprints ABOUT genes, variants, diseases, or chemicals\n\
    \    - \"trial\": Search ClinicalTrials.gov for clinical studies\n    - \"variant\"\
    : Search MyVariant.info for genetic variant DATABASE RECORDS (population frequency,\
    \ clinical significance, etc.) - NOT for articles about variants!\n\n    Example:\n\
    \    ```\n    await search(\n        domain=\"article\",\n        genes=[\"BRAF\"\
    , \"NRAS\"],\n        diseases=[\"melanoma\"],\n        page_size=50\n    )\n\
    \    ```\n\n    ## DOMAIN SELECTION EXAMPLES:\n    - To find ARTICLES about BRAF\
    \ V600E mutation: domain=\"article\", genes=[\"BRAF\"], variants=[\"V600E\"]\n\
    \    - To find VARIANT DATA for BRAF mutations: domain=\"variant\", gene=\"BRAF\"\
    \n    - To find articles about ERBB2 p.D277Y: domain=\"article\", genes=[\"ERBB2\"\
    ], variants=[\"p.D277Y\"]\n    - Common mistake: Using domain=\"variant\" when\

    \ for specific records\n    - Use get_schema=True to explore available search\
    \ fields\n    - Use explain_query=True to understand query parsing (unified mode)\n\

    \ OR with pipe separator: \"R173|Arg173|p.R173\"\n    - Remember: domain=\"article\"\
    \ finds LITERATURE, domain=\"variant\" finds DATABASE RECORDS\n\n    ## RETURN\

    ,\n                \"title\": \"Human-readable title\",\n                \"text\"\

    library ID UNLESS the user explicitly provides a library ID in the format ''/org/project''
    or ''/org/project/version'' in their query.


    Selection Process:

    1. Analyze the query to understand what library/package the user is looking for

    2. Return the most relevant match based on:

    - Name similarity to the query (exact matches prioritized)

    - Description relevance to the query''s intent

    - Documentation coverage (prioritize libraries with higher Code Snippet counts)

    - Trust score (consider libraries with scores of 7-10 more authoritative)


    Response Format:

    - Return the selected library ID in a clearly marked section

    - Provide a brief explanation for why this library was chosen

    - If multiple good matches exist, acknowledge this but proceed with the most relevant
    one

    - If no good matches exist, clearly state this and suggest query refinements


    For ambiguous queries, request clarification before proceeding with a best-guess
    match.'

  tool_description: 'Generate a radar chart to display multidimensional data (four
    dimensions or more), such as, evaluate Huawei and Apple phones in terms of five
    dimensions: ease of use, functionality, camera, benchmark scores, and battery
    life.'
  inputschema:
    data: '(array) Data for radar chart, such as, [{ name: ''Design'', value: 70 }].'
    theme: (Optional, string) Set the theme for the chart, optional, default is 'default'.
    width: (Optional, number) Set the width of chart, default is 600.
    height: (Optional, number) Set the height of chart, default is 400.
    title: (Optional, string) Set the title of chart.

    spoken_language: (Optional, string) Spoken language to filter repositories by

- server_name: yfmcp

  inputschema:

    top_type: (string) Type of top companies to retrieve
    top_n: (Optional, integer) Number of top entities to retrieve (limit the results)

- server_name: datagov

    all_fields: (Optional, boolean) Return all fields
